result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David C Stahl

defendant.name: Stahl, David C
defendant.address: 3900 W Brown Deer Rd #219, Milwaukee, WI 53209

records.addlTxt: to be done outpatient, signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr November 3, 2022.
Review hearing on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:06 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant David C Stahl not in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for David C Stahl.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Herbers advises he has been in contact with his client and is not able to appear today due to some mental health treatment.  Based on that information Atty. Herbers raises issues of competency. 
 DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days, but noting that the defendant is anticipated to be placed in a mental health treatment facility very soon.  Atty. Herbers advises he can reach out to the doctor to advise them where the defendant is located for the competency evaluation.  Court will adjourn for review hearing.  Court also notes there was a WCS non-compliance letter and will address that at the next court date as well.
Review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Herbers as counsel of record for the defendant.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

10:18 AM Defendant David C Stahl in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for David C Stahl.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Herbers will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
